solution-article.title: What Cryptocurrency do we cover

solution-article.desc-un-html: Centralised exchanges are platforms which facilitate the buying and selling of cryptocurrency, either for fiat currencies like the US dollar, or between digital assets like BTC and ETH
solution-article.description: Centralised exchanges are platforms which facilitate the buying and selling of cryptocurrency, either for fiat currencies like the US dollar, or between digital assets like BTC and ETH
solution-article.title: What is a centralised exchange?

solution-article.desc-un-html: Cold wallets - a place to store digital funds. Funds held in cold wallets are stored off-line, i.e. no internet access, so are more secure than Hot Wallets.
solution-article.description: Cold wallets - a place to store digital funds. Funds held in cold wallets are stored off-line, i.e. no internet  access, so are more secure than Hot Wallets.
solution-article.title: What is a Cold Wallet

solution-article.desc-un-html: A Hot Wallet is a place to store digital funds. These wallets are accessible online - typically exchange platforms use hot wallets. They are usually kept secure by a 2FA method of access and/or white lists.
solution-article.description: A Hot Wallet is a place to store digital funds.  These wallets are accessible online - typically exchange platforms use hot wallets.  They are usually kept secure by a 2FA method of access and/or white lists.
solution-article.title: What is a Hot Wallet

solution-article.desc-un-html: Whitelisting is a security feature in the Address Book of a wallet which allows Crypto withdrawals to only go to addresses already designated/present in the address book. A 2FA is required to enable or disable this feature. It allows users to safely withdrawer funds to send to various addresses.
solution-article.description: Whitelisting is a security feature in the Address Book of a wallet which allows Crypto withdrawals to only go to addresses already designated/present in the address book.  A 2FA is required to enable or disable this feature.  It allows users to safely withdrawer funds to send to various addresses.
solution-article.title: What is White Listing

solution-article.desc-un-html: Coincover currently only cover Cold Wallets
solution-article.description: Coincover currently only cover Cold Wallets
solution-article.title: Do Coincover offer protection on Hot Wallets

solution-article.desc-un-html: A test workspace is not live - it is set up for testing use only.
solution-article.description: A test workspace is not live - it is set up for testing use only.
solution-article.title: What is a Test Workspace

solution-article.desc-un-html: We currently do not accept stable coins
solution-article.description: We currently do not accept stable coins
solution-article.title: Do we accept Stable Coins

solution-article.desc-un-html: Thanks for getting in touch, we’re currently working with a number of wallets and exchanges to expand our coverage, we can let you know once your wallet/exchange is listed.
solution-article.description: Thanks for getting in touch, we’re currently working with a number of wallets and exchanges to expand our coverage, we can let you know once your wallet/exchange is listed.
solution-article.title: I’d like to protect an wallet or exchange that isn’t listed.

solution-article.desc-un-html: If a customer logs a ticket to advise they are no longer able to sign into their account - I am trying to access my Coincover Bitcoin account and when I try to login my Email address is not being recognised ( XXXXXXX@hotmail.co.uk ) can you please help me to regain access to my account. You will need to assign the ticket to the "product and technical" group and assign the ticket to Morgan, Bogdan or Adam. From the Freshdesk ticket, send a holding email to the customer to advise that we have forwarded the query to our technical team and will come back to them as soon as we get a response. From the Freshdesk ticket, send an email to the person you have assigned the ticket to from the technical team to alert them to the ticket. If they don't come back within 4 hours, chase them again. We aim to get the answer back to the customer within 24 hours of the ticket being logged.
solution-article.description:
If a customer logs a ticket to advise they are no longer able to sign into their account - 


I am trying to access my Coincover Bitcoin account and when I try to login my Email address is not being recognised ( XXXXXXX@hotmail.co.uk ) can you please help me to regain access to my account.  


You will need to assign the ticket to the "product and technical" group and assign the ticket to Morgan, Bogdan or Adam.  


From the Freshdesk ticket, send a holding email to the customer to advise that we have forwarded the query to our technical team and will come back to them as soon as we get a response.


From the Freshdesk ticket, send an email to the person you have assigned the ticket to from the technical team to alert them to the ticket.


If they don't come back within 4 hours, chase them again.


We aim to get the answer back to the customer within 24 hours of the ticket being logged.
solution-article.title: Legacy Customer Base

solution-article.desc-un-html: This is not something that we offer. We only provide Theft Protection
solution-article.description: This is not something that we offer. We only provide Theft Protection
solution-article.title: Do you provide AML (Anti-Money Laundering) Insurance?

solution-article.desc-un-html: Crypto.com have their own corporate wallets covered against hacking and theft, their individual consumers are not covered against this. So if an individuals personal device gets hacked, they are not covered for the crypto stolen from their account. Coincover however does provides theft protection for the individual in case of hacking, theft, attack, etc.
solution-article.description:
Crypto.com have their own corporate wallets covered against hacking and theft, their individual consumers are not covered against this. So if an individuals personal device gets hacked, they are not covered for the crypto stolen from their account.


Coincover however does provides theft protection for the individual in case of hacking, theft, attack, etc.
solution-article.title: What makes you different from Crypto.com Cover?

solution-article.desc-un-html: Our technology led solution is designed to provide warning of unusual transaction activity in a registered wallet. However, as per our terms of service - https://assets.coincover.com/documents/terms-of-use.pdf - our protection doesn't extend to the failure of a digital asset smart contract.
solution-article.description: Our technology led solution is designed to provide warning of unusual transaction activity in a registered wallet. However, as per our terms of service - https://assets.coincover.com/documents/terms-of-use.pdf - our protection doesn't extend to the failure of a digital asset smart contract.
solution-article.title: Does the Cover include Hot Wallets covered by Smart Contracts?

solution-article.desc-un-html: We do not currently offer this but thank you for making us aware of this provider. We are looking to expand everyday so please feel free to keep an eye out for this.
solution-article.description: We do not currently offer this but thank you for making us aware of this provider. We are looking to expand everyday so please feel free to keep an eye out for this.
solution-article.title: Do you offer Cover for assets stored in a Stargazer wallet?

solution-article.desc-un-html: They do not cover Hot Wallets, doesn't have a no-deductible option and doesn't protect against third party hacks, phishing and malware. They are not available globally like we are and only available in a few US States.
solution-article.description:
They do not cover Hot Wallets, doesn't have a no-deductible option and doesn't protect against third party hacks, phishing and malware. 

They are not available globally like we are and only available in a few US States.
solution-article.title: What makes you different from BreachInsured Crypto Cover?

solution-article.desc-un-html: If you wish to cover more then $100k worth of crypto, please input your information in the query form located on the Coincover Protection page. please click on MAX plan and a form will pop up - This is currently not available as we are trying to see how much interest the public have on this. Here is the link to the page, https://www.coincover.com/products/personal-crypto-protection.
solution-article.description:
If you wish to cover more then $100k worth of crypto, please input your information in the query form located on the Coincover Protection page. please click on MAX plan and a form will pop up - This is currently not available as we are trying to see how much interest the public have on this.

Here is the link to the page, https://www.coincover.com/products/personal-crypto-protection.
solution-article.title: Do you allow Cover over 100k?

solution-article.desc-un-html: Yes, at the end of your included cover you are eligible to upgrade to a full year and subsequent years of cover.
solution-article.description: Yes, at the end of your included cover you are eligible to upgrade to a full year and subsequent years of cover.
solution-article.title: Can I upgrade or extend my cover? - NFT's

solution-article.desc-un-html: All NFTbox owners are eligible for Coincover NFT protection, but must sign up, which includes confirming your NFTbox subscription, connecting your Metamask wallet and completing an ID verification.
solution-article.description: All NFTbox owners are eligible for Coincover NFT protection, but must sign up, which includes confirming your NFTbox subscription, connecting your Metamask wallet and completing an ID verification.
solution-article.title: How do I get my NFTs protected?

solution-article.desc-un-html: Protection is provided to you for the duration of your subscription. A single NFTbox purchase covers for 1 month, a 3-box subscription covers for 4 months, a 6-box subscription covers for 9 months and a 12 box subscription covers for a year.
solution-article.description: Protection is provided to you for the duration of your subscription. A single NFTbox purchase covers for 1 month, a 3-box subscription covers for 4 months, a 6-box subscription covers for 9 months and a 12 box subscription covers for a year.
solution-article.title: How long does my NFTbox protection last?

solution-article.desc-un-html: Coincover’ NFT Protection looks for suspicious activity to protect you against a wide range of risks to your crypto assets, including: • Hacking - someone taking funds after accessing a computer system they’re not authorized to use. • Device Theft - theft of a phone, laptop or other device, which enables access to your account or wallet to remove funds. • Phishing - theft of your user details through pretending to be a trustworthy organisation. • Malware - a computer program that gets access to and exploits your data to withdraw funds. • Brute Force Attack - a sustained attack that submits multiple usernames and passwords to gain access to your account. • Trojans - Software that misleads you about its true purpose to access and send your data to the attacker.
solution-article.description:
Coincover’ NFT Protection looks for suspicious activity to protect you against a wide range of risks to your crypto assets, including:
 
• Hacking - someone taking funds after accessing a computer system they’re not authorized to use.
• Device Theft - theft of a phone, laptop or other device, which enables access to your account or wallet to remove funds.
• Phishing - theft of your user details through pretending to be a trustworthy organisation.
• Malware - a computer program that gets access to and exploits your data to withdraw funds.
• Brute Force Attack - a sustained attack that submits multiple usernames and passwords to gain access to your account.
• Trojans - Software that misleads you about its true purpose to access and send your data to the attacker.
solution-article.title: What does Coincover NFT Protection do?

solution-article.desc-un-html: Coincover Protection is not able to protect you against things such as: • Transferring NFTs - you, or someone authorized by you, transfers cryptocurrency. • Blockchain Failure - failure, breakdown or disruption of a blockchain network. • Hardware Loss or Damage - physical loss or damage to hardware. • Price Fluctuations - loss of value due to price changes. Because our technology cannot prevent these, it is not possible to claim funds from us if they do happen.
solution-article.description:
Coincover Protection is not able to protect you against things such as:
 
• Transferring NFTs - you, or someone authorized by you, transfers cryptocurrency.
• Blockchain Failure - failure, breakdown or disruption of a blockchain network.
• Hardware Loss or Damage - physical loss or damage to hardware.
• Price Fluctuations - loss of value due to price changes.
 
Because our technology cannot prevent these, it is not possible to claim funds from us if they do happen.
solution-article.title: What does Coincover NFT Protection not do?

solution-article.desc-un-html: A single box purchase or each of the three subscription plans come with different levels of cover: • A single NFTbox purchase provides 1 month of cover to a maximum protection of $5,000 • A 3 box subscription covers for 4 months of cover to a maximum protection of $10,000 • A 6 box subscription covers for 8 months of cover to a maximum protection of $15,000 • A 9 box subscription covers for 12 months of cover to a maximum protection of $20,000
solution-article.description:
A single box purchase or each of the three subscription plans come with different levels of cover:
 
• A single NFTbox purchase provides 1 month of cover to a maximum protection of $5,000
• A 3 box subscription covers for 4 months of cover to a maximum protection of $10,000
• A 6 box subscription covers for 8 months of cover to a maximum protection of $15,000
• A 9 box subscription covers for 12 months of cover to a maximum protection of $20,000
solution-article.title: What does my Coincover NFT Protection include?

solution-article.desc-un-html: No, the initial protection is included with your NFTbox subscription and, as such, we would not take payment details from you.
solution-article.description: No, the initial protection is included with your NFTbox subscription and, as such, we would not take payment details from you.
solution-article.title: Will you take any payment details?

solution-article.desc-un-html: The MPC device key share is the third of a set of 3 key shares, that is stored physically on the device. A copy of this key share is stored on Fireblocks managed cloud services, encrypted with the owner’s recovery passphrase. Under the soft recovery setup with Coincover - an additional copy of this key share is created, encrypted with the auto-generated passphrase that is stored by Coincover.
solution-article.description: The MPC device key share is the third of a set of 3 key shares, that is stored physically on the device. A copy of this key share is stored on Fireblocks managed cloud services, encrypted with the owner’s recovery passphrase. Under the soft recovery setup with Coincover - an additional copy of this key share is created, encrypted with the auto-generated passphrase that is stored by Coincover.
solution-article.title: What Does The MPC Key Share Mean?

solution-article.desc-un-html: To add an ACL, this will need to be agreed by 2 out of the 3 on the ACL list. To add an additional ACL all we need is their name, email address, telephone and role. The will need to undertake an ID check. Once this has been received, we will need to arrange a meeting with the ACLs in order to have this action confirmed verbally via a video call.
solution-article.description:
To add an ACL, this will need to be agreed by 2 out of the 3 on the ACL list. 

To add an additional ACL all we need is their name, email address, telephone and role.  The will need to undertake an ID check.  Once this has been received, we will need to arrange a meeting with the ACLs in order to have this action confirmed verbally via a video call.
solution-article.title: How do I add an ACL?

solution-article.desc-un-html: Removing an ACL needs to be agreed by a minimum of 2 ACL members. If there are only 2 left, another will need to be added to make up the 3 minimum members. We will need to arrange a video meeting with the ACLs in order to confirm this action verbally, and if required follow the process to add and ACL.
solution-article.description:
Removing an ACL needs to be agreed by a minimum of 2 ACL members.
If there are only 2 left, another will need to be added to make up the 3 minimum members.
We will need to arrange a video meeting with the ACLs in order to confirm this action verbally, and if required follow the process to add and ACL.
solution-article.title: How do I remove an ACL?

solution-article.desc-un-html: Fireblocks is a platform for running digital asset businesses.
solution-article.description: Fireblocks is a platform for running digital asset businesses.
solution-article.title: Who are Fireblocks

solution-article.desc-un-html: This is an agreement between the client and Fireblocks which authorises Fireblocks to work with us on the customer's behalf. We cannot commence onboarding or activate cover until this is signed and sent back to Fireblocks.
solution-article.description: This is an agreement between the client and Fireblocks which authorises Fireblocks to work with us on the customer's behalf.  We cannot commence onboarding or activate cover until this is signed and sent back to Fireblocks.
solution-article.title: What is a DRS agreement with Fireblocks

solution-article.desc-un-html: The customer needs to complete their onboarding and pay any outstanding invoices before we can undertake a test recovery, both in a live or test environment.
solution-article.description: The customer needs to complete their onboarding and pay any outstanding invoices before we can undertake a test recovery, both in a live or test environment.
solution-article.title: When can a customer undertake a test recovery?

solution-article.desc-un-html: If an account owner loses access to their workspace, Coincover will typically be able to recover access.
solution-article.description: If an account owner loses access to their workspace, Coincover will typically be able to recover access.
solution-article.title: What is a Key Recovery?

solution-article.desc-un-html: This usually takes 2 working days.
solution-article.description: This usually takes 2 working days.
solution-article.title: How long does the Key Recovery process take

solution-article.desc-un-html: The account owner contacts Fireblocks to initiate the recovery Fireblocks informs Coincover of the request - Coincover then contacts the customer to validate this Fireblocks set the Account Owners device into "recovery mode" Coincover decrypts the Account Holder's recovery passphrase and shares it securely The Account Holder enters the recovery passphrase into the Fireblocks app to complete the recovery
solution-article.description:
The account owner contacts Fireblocks to initiate the recovery

Fireblocks informs Coincover of the request - Coincover then contacts the customer to validate this

Fireblocks set the Account Owners device into "recovery mode"

Coincover decrypts the Account Holder's recovery passphrase and shares it securely 

The Account Holder enters the recovery passphrase into the Fireblocks app to complete the recovery
solution-article.title: Key Recovery Process

solution-article.desc-un-html: In the unlikely event that Fireblocks is no longer operational, the customer will still be able to gain access to their wallets private keys protected by Coincover. The Account Holder uses a Fireblocks tool to initiate the recovery and contacts Coincover Coincover will initiate the recovery - 2 verified members of the company will be required to authorise the request Once verified, Coincover will retrieve the customer back up data and then use the Backup Key to decrypt the Fireblocks key shares, before sharing this with the account holder The backup material can be used with the Fireblocks tool to decrypt and regain access to the private keys
solution-article.description:
In the unlikely event that Fireblocks is no longer operational, the customer will still be able to gain access to their wallets private keys protected by Coincover.


  • The Account Holder uses a Fireblocks tool to initiate the recovery and contacts Coincover 
  • Coincover will initiate the recovery - 2 verified members of the company will be required to authorise the request
  • Once verified, Coincover will retrieve the customer back up data and then use the Backup Key to decrypt the Fireblocks key shares, before sharing this with the account holder
  • The backup material can be used with the Fireblocks tool to decrypt and regain access to the private keys
solution-article.title: Key Recovery Process in the event Fireblocks cease trading

solution-article.desc-un-html: Customers need to have a test space in order to set up a test recovery. Advise Sean (or current POC at Fireblocks) that a customer wishes to set up a test recovery. He will then advise what to do next. We need to set up a "test" public key - request this with Demi or Kath. Fireblocks will generate a zip file which they will add to Insights. CS team to advise Brad (or current POC) that there will be a test public key on Insights. We provide the customer with the Zip file and the private key (which comes from Brad or the current POC). We let the customer know that they need to undertake the process themselves (see email templates)
solution-article.description:
Customers need to have a test space in order to set up a test recovery.


Advise Sean (or current POC at Fireblocks) that a customer wishes to set up a test recovery.  He will then advise what to do next.

We need to set up a "test" public key - request this with Demi or Kath.

Fireblocks will generate a zip file which they will add to Insights.

CS team to advise Brad (or current POC) that there will be a test public key on Insights.

We provide the customer with the Zip file and the private key (which comes from Brad or the current POC).

We let the customer know that they need to undertake the process themselves (see email templates)
solution-article.title: Test Recoveries

solution-article.desc-un-html: Sharding splits a blockchain company's entire network into smaller partitions, know as shards. Each shard is comprised of it's own data making it unique and independent when compared to other shards. Sharding reduces network congestion and increases transactions per second by creating new chains (shards).
solution-article.description: Sharding splits a blockchain company's entire network into smaller partitions, know as shards.  Each shard is comprised of it's own data making it unique and independent when compared to other shards.  Sharding reduces network congestion and increases transactions per second by creating new chains (shards).
solution-article.title: What is a Shard?

solution-article.desc-un-html: In the unlikely event the business was no longer operational, the £1,197 Extended Business Failure is an additional service whereby we continue servicing the customer for 3 months by appointing a third-party administrator to recover customers funds to new wallets by working with an estate/lawyer. This is entirely optional - the customer can choose not to include this, but it is recommended.
solution-article.description: 1. In the unlikely event the business was no longer operational, the £1,197 Extended Business Failure is an additional service whereby we continue servicing the customer for 3 months by appointing a third-party administrator to recover customers funds to new wallets by working with an estate/lawyer. This is entirely optional - the customer can choose not to include this, but it is recommended.
solution-article.title: What is the Extended Business Failure?

solution-article.desc-un-html: If they forget the passphrase, they will need to notify Fireblocks to re-set this. From Coincover’s viewpoint, the same public key can be used many times a it is merely an encryption method. The only thing that changes is the encryption from the customers end, the recovery passphrase. The Device Recovery (Soft DRS) procedure is completely unrelated to the Offline (hard backup) and it was already completed and does not need to be redone. Running the process again would create another randomized backup passphrase and CoinCover would then not have the most recent one created. Fireblocks share the previous 5 passphrases in case of an emergency.
solution-article.description:
If they forget the passphrase, they will need to notify Fireblocks to re-set this.  From Coincover’s viewpoint, the same public key can be used many times a it is merely an encryption method. The only thing that changes is the encryption from the customers end, the recovery passphrase. 

 

The Device Recovery (Soft DRS) procedure is completely unrelated to the Offline (hard backup) and it was already completed and   does not need to be redone. Running the process again would create another randomized backup passphrase and CoinCover would then not have the most recent one created.

Fireblocks share the previous 5 passphrases in case of an emergency.
solution-article.title: What happens if the customer loses their Passphrase with Fireblocks?

solution-article.desc-un-html: This is the customers password for their Fireblocks workspace. To perform a recovery, they will need to enter this into the Fireblocks app to access their funds. It is important that we stress the importance of them storing this somewhere safe, and it being apart of their Business Continuity Plan.
solution-article.description:
This is the customers password for their Fireblocks workspace. 

To perform a recovery, they will need to enter this into the Fireblocks app to access their funds. It is important that we stress the importance of them storing this somewhere safe, and it being apart of their Business Continuity Plan.
solution-article.title: What is the customer Passphrase - Fireblocks

solution-article.desc-un-html: You need to connect the account so that we can provide monitoring services to protect you against theft. In the event of a claim we will also be able to view activity leading up to a loss.
solution-article.description: You need to connect the account so that we can provide monitoring services to protect you against theft. In the event of a claim we will also be able to view activity leading up to a loss.
solution-article.title: Why do I need to connect my account?

solution-article.desc-un-html: Vezgo provides an API that enables Coincover to connect with multiple crypto currency exchanges and wallets.
solution-article.description: Vezgo provides an API that enables Coincover to connect with multiple crypto currency exchanges and wallets.
solution-article.title: Who is Vezgo?

solution-article.desc-un-html: Thanks for getting in touch, we’re currently working with a number of wallets and exchanges to expand our coverage, we can let you know once your wallet/exchange is listed.
solution-article.description: Thanks for getting in touch, we’re currently working with a number of wallets and exchanges to expand our coverage, we can let you know once your wallet/exchange is listed.
solution-article.title: I’d like to protect an wallet or exchange that isn’t listed.

solution-article.desc-un-html: Are you getting any errors when you try to connect the account? If you can’t or don’t connect after 30 days we will provide a full refund.
solution-article.description: Are you getting any errors when you try to connect the account? If you can’t or don’t connect after 30 days we will provide a full refund.
solution-article.title: I’ve bought cover but can’t connect my account

solution-article.desc-un-html: We will refund you in full within 30 days.
solution-article.description: We will refund you in full within 30 days.
solution-article.title: I’ve bought cover but don’t want to connect my account.

solution-article.desc-un-html: The consumer app journey allows a customer to purchase protection and then connect a wallet so that we can provide protection. There are 4 ways that a wallet can be connected: Wallet: The simplest method, you will be asked to provide your wallet address Read only API Token: Each platform has a different way of doing this. The table below has links to each of the platform's instructions. Oauth: (Only Coinbase which isn’t listed), you can login via Coinbase to link the account User name and Password: The user will enter in their username and password to enable the connection The wallet connecting functionality is provided by a 3rd party service called Vezgo. If a customer has problems connecting then it’s likely that this is a technical issue on their side.
solution-article.description:
The consumer app journey allows a customer to purchase protection and then connect a wallet so that we can provide protection.  

 

There are 4 ways that a wallet can be connected:

  1. Wallet: The simplest method, you will be asked to provide your  wallet address 
  2. Read only API Token: Each platform has a different way of doing this. The table below has links to each of the platform's instructions.
  3. Oauth: (Only Coinbase which isn’t listed), you can login via Coinbase to link the account
  4. User name and Password: The user will enter in their username and password to enable the connection

 

The wallet connecting functionality is provided by a 3rd party service called Vezgo. If a customer has problems connecting then it’s likely that this is a technical issue on their side.
solution-article.title: Information about the Consumer App

solution-article.desc-un-html: Update your account details like name, email address, phone number or address, anytime by following these steps: Select account details from the menu bar. Click edit icon on the field you'd like to change. After you’ve added the updated details, click save changes. Click done after completing all the updates. You will receive an email from us to verify the changes. In case you have forgotten your password, click on the forgot password button and follow the instructions there. Note: Once you verify the updated email details, you can resume your activities on your account.
solution-article.description:
Update your account details like name, email address, phone number or address, anytime by following these steps:

  1. Select account details from the menu bar.
  2. Click edit icon on the field you'd like to change.
  3. After you’ve added the updated details, click save changes.
  4. Click done after completing all the updates.
  5. You will receive an email from us to verify the changes.

In case you have forgotten your password, click on the forgot password button and follow the instructions there.

Note: Once you verify the updated email details, you can resume your activities on your account.
solution-article.title: Changing account details

solution-article.desc-un-html: To set up payment channels on your account, Select payment options from the menu bar. Click the add payment method option. Pick the options from the checklist and fill in the required details. After you’ve added the details, click save. Click done once you’ve finished. Tip: You can always come back and add or delete more options, by following the same steps. The different payment channels supported at Saul’s are - Google Pay PayPal WePay Note: We also offer cash on delivery.
solution-article.description:
To set up payment channels on your account,

  1. Select payment options from the menu bar.
  2. Click the add payment method option.
  3. Pick the options from the checklist and fill in the required details.
  4. After you’ve added the details, click save.
  5. Click done once you’ve finished.

Tip: You can always come back and add or delete more options, by following the same steps.

The different payment channels supported at Saul’s are -
  • Google Pay
  • PayPal
  • WePay

Note: We also offer cash on delivery.
solution-article.title: Adding a payment method

solution-folder.description: Folder for adding Your account articles
solution-folder.name: Your account

solution-category.description: Marketing and promotional materials and advice
solution-category.name: Marketing and Promotions

solution-article.desc-un-html: If you have placed on order and you want to check its status, you can view this from Saul’s account. Step 1 - Go to my orders. Step 2 - Click on the order you want to track. Step 3 - Click on details. You can also check the status of your order on your phone, by clicking the “Enable updates via SMS” button. Make sure the phone number present there is valid (if not, you can edit it by clicking on the edit icon next to the field). The updates on your orders will be messaged to you on your phone.
solution-article.description:
If you have placed on order and you want to check its status, you can view this from Saul’s account.
Step 1 - Go to my orders.

Step 2 - Click on the order you want to track.

Step 3 - Click on details.

You can also check the status of your order on your phone, by clicking the “Enable updates via SMS” button.

Make sure the phone number present there is valid (if not, you can edit it by clicking on the edit icon next to the field).

The updates on your orders will be messaged to you on your phone.
solution-article.title: Tracking your order

solution-article.desc-un-html: Typically, your package should reach you within 2-9 days of placing an order. In case you want your order to reach you within three days, then you select the fast delivery option before placing your order.
solution-article.description: Typically, your package should reach you within 2-9 days of placing an order. In case you want your order to reach you within three days, then you select the fast delivery option before placing your order.
solution-article.title: How long will the delivery take?

solution-article.desc-un-html: We understand that you might not always be available at the scheduled time for delivery generated by us. So we let you pick your delivery slot based on your convenience. In case you miss it, we make two more attempts at the slot selected by you on two consecutive business days.
solution-article.description:
We understand that you might not always be available at the scheduled time for delivery generated by us. So we let you pick your delivery slot based on your convenience.
In case you miss it, we make two more attempts at the slot selected by you on two consecutive business days.
solution-article.title: Is the delivery time flexible?

solution-article.desc-un-html: We ship all packages with an invoice that can be found along with the product. If you need a copy of the invoice, we can email it to you.
solution-article.description: We ship all packages with an invoice that can be found along with the product. If you need a copy of the invoice, we can email it to you.
solution-article.title: I need a copy of my invoice for my order. How do I go about with it?

solution-article.desc-un-html: We offer four cover levels: $1000 for $32 $10,000 @$107 $100,000 @$755 $1,000,000 - contact us to discuss pricing
solution-article.description:
We offer four cover levels: 
  • $1000 for $32 
  • $10,000 @$107
  • $100,000 @$755
  • $1,000,000 - contact us to discuss pricing
solution-article.title: What amounts do you cover for theft protection

solution-article.desc-un-html: We cover all online wallets. We don't provide cover for cold wallets
solution-article.description: We cover all online wallets. We don't provide cover for cold wallets
solution-article.title: What wallets can I get cover for?

solution-article.desc-un-html: All theft and loss of cryptocurrency funds resulting from proven third-party hacks or theft of private keys including brute force attack, cyber-attacks, phishing software, malicious software, trojans, worms, hacking, device theft (we do not cover the cost of replacing the device, rather the amount of stolen crypto), and insider attack.
solution-article.description: All theft and loss of cryptocurrency funds resulting from proven third-party hacks or theft of private keys including brute force attack, cyber-attacks, phishing software, malicious software, trojans, worms, hacking, device theft (we do not cover the cost of replacing the device, rather the amount of stolen crypto), and insider attack.
solution-article.title: What is covered under Theft Cover?

solution-article.desc-un-html: There are two main exclusions: Wilful sending of digital currency by you or someone authorised by you Failure, breakdown or disruption of a cryptocurrency blockchain
solution-article.description:
There are two main exclusions: 
  • Wilful sending of digital currency by you or someone authorised by you 
  • Failure, breakdown or disruption of a cryptocurrency blockchain
solution-article.title: What are the main exclusions to Theft Cover?

solution-article.desc-un-html: Once we have received your claim, we carry out the following steps to calculate the loss: Identify the transactions on the relevant blockchains to determine the date and time of the theft and the exact amount of cryptocurrency stolen Calculate the value using the fiat currency valuation of the cryptocurrency provided by coingecko.com at the date and time of loss
solution-article.description:
Once we have received your claim, we carry out the following steps to calculate the loss:  
  • Identify the transactions on the relevant blockchains to determine the date and time of the theft and the exact amount of cryptocurrency stolen 
  • Calculate the value using the fiat currency valuation of the cryptocurrency provided by coingecko.com at the date and time of loss
solution-article.title: How do you calculate the value of my claim?

solution-article.desc-un-html: To help us protect your assets: You must tell us immediately if you suspect your assets have been stolen and report the theft to the Police. You must tell us of any circumstances which you think may give rise to a loss in future. You must take reasonable care of your digital assets as set out in the Terms of Use. You must take reasonable care to give us full, complete and accurate information to the questions we ask. You must tell us if your circumstances change, and if you wish to vary the amount of cover you have. You must help us investigate the background and/or causes of any theft and be prepared to share information with us.
solution-article.description:
To help us protect your assets: 
  • You must tell us immediately if you suspect your assets have been stolen and report the theft to the Police. 
  • You must tell us of any circumstances which you think may give rise to a loss in future. 
  • You must take reasonable care of your digital assets as set out in the Terms of Use. 
  • You must take reasonable care to give us full, complete and accurate information to the questions we ask. 
  • You must tell us if your circumstances change, and if you wish to vary the amount of cover you have. 
  • You must help us investigate the background and/or causes of any theft and be prepared to share information with us.
solution-article.title: What are my obligations?
Gift vouchers for birthdays

solution-article.desc-un-html: Once we have received your claim, we carry out the following steps to calculate the loss: Identify the transactions on the relevant blockchains to determine the date and time of the theft and the exact amount of cryptocurrency stolen Calculate the value using the fiat currency valuation of the cryptocurrency provided by coingecko.com at the date and time of loss

Once we have received your claim, we carry out the following steps to calculate the loss:

  • Calculate the value using the fiat currency valuation of the cryptocurrency provided by coingecko.com at the date and time of loss

solution-article.desc-un-html: No, there is no excess/deductibles to pay
solution-article.description: No, there is no excess/deductibles to pay
solution-article.title: Will I need to pay an excess/deductible if I make a claim?

solution-article.desc-un-html: Next steps that the customer is advised to do once they have returned the claim form to us: Please confirm your identity using this Link. You will need government issued identification such as a passport or driving licence to complete the ID checks. Please fill in and return the attached claim form. Once we have confirmed your identity and received your completed claim form, we will investigate your claim and keep you up to date with its status. We will then contact you to arrange a video interview to discuss your claim. Investigating a claim can take up to 25 days, sometimes longer if there are complex issues. Once the investigation is complete, we will let you know whether your claim has been successful.
solution-article.description:
Next steps that the customer is advised to do once they have returned the claim form to us: 

  1. Please confirm your identity using this Link. You will need government issued identification such as a passport or driving licence to complete the ID checks.

  2. Please fill in and return the attached claim form.

  3. Once we have confirmed your identity and received your completed claim form, we will investigate your claim and keep you up to date with its status. 

  4. We will then contact you to arrange a video interview to discuss your claim.

  5. Investigating a claim can take up to 25 days, sometimes longer if there are complex issues.
     
  6. Once the investigation is complete, we will let you know whether your claim has been successful.
solution-article.title: customer claim - steps for customer after receipt of claims form
Coupons for members
Coupons for non-members

solution-article.desc-un-html: If a customer contacts us to request a recovery, please put the ticket under "recoveries and claims" group and send an email from the ticket to keys@coincover.com Send a holding email to the customer from the canned responses - "holding email for tech queries" Chase after 4 hours if no response as we need to get the ticket resolved within 24 hours of receipt.
solution-article.description:
If a customer contacts us to request a recovery, please put the ticket under "recoveries and claims" group and send an email from the ticket to keys@coincover.com


Send a holding email to the customer from the canned responses - "holding email for tech queries"


Chase after 4 hours if no response as we need to get the ticket resolved within 24 hours of receipt.
solution-article.title: Recoveries - who to contact

solution-article.desc-un-html: Recovering Device Access If the Account Owner loses access to their device, Coincover works with Fireblocks to get them back up and running on a new device. We need to find out in the first instance if the customer has lost their passphrase - if so, the following steps apply: The Account Owner contacts Fireblocks to initiate a recovery. Fireblocks informs Coincover of the claim, Coincover then contacts the user directly to validate their claim. Fireblocks set the Account Owner's device into 'Recovery Mode'. Coincover decrypts the Account Owner's recovery passphrase and shares it securely. The Account Owner enters the recovery passphrase into the Fireblocks app to complete the recovery. If the account owner has lost their passphrase and therefore access to their device BUT is able to access other devices in the workspace, they will need to contact Fireblocks Support directly to recover their access to a new device. If the Account Owner has lost their device but they still have their passphrase, they will need to contact Fireblocks Support directly for recovery. Recovering Account Access In the unlikely event that Fireblocks is no longer operational, the Account Owner will still regain access to their wallet's private keys protected by Coincover. The Account Owner uses a Fireblocks tool to initiate the recovery and contacts Coincover. Coincover will verify the recovery. We will require at least 2 verified members from your company to authorise the request. Once verified, Coincover will retrieve your backup data and then use the Backup Key to decrypt the Fireblocks key shares, before sharing this with the Account Owner. The backup material can be used with the Fireblocks tool to decrypt and regain access to the private keys.
solution-article.description:
Recovering Device Access  

  

If the Account Owner loses access to their device, Coincover works with Fireblocks to get them back up and running on a new device.   

  

  • We need to find out in the first instance if the customer has lost their passphrase - if so, the following steps apply:



  • The Account Owner contacts Fireblocks to initiate a recovery.   
  • Fireblocks informs Coincover of the claim, Coincover then contacts the user directly to validate their claim.    
  • Fireblocks set the Account Owner's device into 'Recovery Mode'.   
  • Coincover decrypts the Account Owner's recovery passphrase and shares it securely.   
  • The Account Owner enters the recovery passphrase into the Fireblocks app to complete the recovery.  


If the account owner has lost their passphrase and therefore access to their device BUT is able to access other devices in the workspace, they will need to contact Fireblocks Support directly to recover their access to a new device.


If the Account Owner has lost their device but they still have their passphrase, they will need to contact Fireblocks Support directly for recovery.

  

Recovering Account Access  

  

In the unlikely event that Fireblocks is no longer operational, the Account Owner will still regain access to their wallet's private keys protected by Coincover.   

  

  • The Account Owner uses a Fireblocks tool to initiate the recovery and contacts Coincover. 
  • Coincover will verify the recovery. We will require at least 2 verified members from your company to authorise the request. 
  • Once verified, Coincover will retrieve your backup data and then use the Backup Key to decrypt the Fireblocks key shares, before sharing this with the Account Owner. 
  • The backup material can be used with the Fireblocks tool to decrypt and regain access to the private keys.
solution-article.title: Fireblocks - Key Recovery Process
Information safety and security
Legal requirements
Email-marketing
Service related announcements

solution-article.desc-un-html: Disaster Recovery is a unique service that prevents the loss of access to digital assets in the event of a disaster, mistake, or human error.
solution-article.description: Disaster Recovery is a unique service that prevents the loss of access to digital assets in the event of a disaster, mistake, or human error.
solution-article.title: What is Disaster Recovery?

solution-article.desc-un-html: Business Protection is the first layer of defence protecting a corporation's digital assets from theft underpinned by an insurance backed guarantee - underwritten by Lloyd's of London. We provide a technology-based approach that monitors transactions taking place within a client's digital environment (hot wallet). This transaction checking approach allows us to monitor legitimate transactions or identify transactions that might be anomalous.
solution-article.description: Business Protection is the first layer of defence protecting a corporation's digital assets from theft underpinned by an insurance backed guarantee - underwritten by Lloyd's of London. We provide a technology-based approach that monitors transactions taking place within a client's digital environment (hot wallet). This transaction checking approach allows us to monitor legitimate transactions or identify transactions that might be anomalous.
solution-article.title: What is Business Protection?

solution-article.desc-un-html: Consumer Protection uses the only technology in the world that protects over 200 types of crypto assets and is underpinned by an insurance-backed Anti-Theft Guarantee to help safeguard crypto investors against financial loss due to hacks or theft.
solution-article.description: Consumer Protection uses the only technology in the world that protects over 200 types of crypto assets and is underpinned by an insurance-backed Anti-Theft Guarantee to help safeguard crypto investors against financial loss due to hacks or theft.
solution-article.title: What is Consumer Protection?

solution-article.desc-un-html: We support Bitgo, Fireblocks and Copper wallets. Other integrations are also available and the number of wallet providers we support is growing. Speak to the team for the most up to date information.
solution-article.description: We support Bitgo, Fireblocks and Copper wallets. Other integrations are also available and the number of wallet providers we support is growing. Speak to the team for the most up to date information.
solution-article.title: Which wallet providers do you support?

solution-article.desc-un-html: In the unlikely event that your crypto is stolen, Coincover customers with theft protection should email, claims@coincover.com and provide the following details: - A local authority crime registration number. - The date the suspected theft took place After we have verified your identity, we will investigate and aim to complete within 25 days. Once the investigation is complete, we will inform you of the outcome. If applicable, we will pay back your stolen funds within 48 hours.
solution-article.description:
In the unlikely event that your crypto is stolen, Coincover customers with theft protection should email, claims@coincover.com and provide the following details:

- A local authority crime registration number.

- The date the suspected theft took place


After we have verified your identity, we will investigate and aim to complete within 25 days. Once the investigation is complete, we will inform you of the outcome. If applicable, we will pay back your stolen funds within 48 hours.
solution-article.title: What do I do if cryptocurrency is taken from my account without my consent?

solution-article.desc-un-html: If your wallet is protected by Coincover, our key recovery services will be able to help you recover your access. We will verify the recovery and guide you through a series of steps to initiate the recovery and retrieve the backup data.
solution-article.description: If your wallet is protected by Coincover, our key recovery services will be able to help you recover your access. We will verify the recovery and guide you through a series of steps to initiate the recovery and retrieve the backup data.
solution-article.title: What happens if I lose access to my wallet?

solution-article.desc-un-html: We protect most major cryptocurrencies and any Standard ERC-20 Token. We keep a list of them here. https://www.coincover.com/covered-cryptocurrencies
solution-article.description: We protect most major cryptocurrencies and any Standard ERC-20 Token. We keep a list of them here. https://www.coincover.com/covered-cryptocurrencies
solution-article.title: Which cryptocurrencies do you protect?

solution-article.desc-un-html: For digital assets on Fireblocks, Coincover will support you in setting up and completing a recovery test. Here are the steps to carry out a test recovery: 1. Inform Coincover - Email support@coincover.com informing us that you wish to perform a test recovery. 2. Set up a test workspace - Coincover will liaise with Fireblocks who will then reach out to you with instruction on how to do this. 3. Carry out the test - We will send you the test kit and instructions on how to undertake the recovery.
solution-article.description:
For digital assets on Fireblocks, Coincover will support you in setting up and completing a recovery test. Here are the steps to carry out a test recovery: 

1. Inform Coincover  - Email support@coincover.com informing us that you wish to perform a test recovery. 

2. Set up a test workspace - Coincover will liaise with Fireblocks who will then reach out to you with instruction on how to do this. 

3. Carry out the test - We will send you the test kit and instructions on how to undertake the recovery.
solution-article.title: How do I perform a test recovery?

solution-article.desc-un-html: The Fireblocks Third Party Letter Agreement allows us to work with Fireblocks on the customer's behalf. This needs to be signed by the customer before we can progress with the customer onboarding.
solution-article.description: The Fireblocks Third Party Letter Agreement allows us to work with Fireblocks on the customer's behalf. This needs to be signed by the customer before we can progress with the customer onboarding.
solution-article.title: What is the purpose of the Fireblocks Third Party Letter agreement?

solution-article.desc-un-html: The Fireblocks soft recovery enrollment, is an additional process undertaken by the customer to ensure they never lose access to their cryptocurrency. The process creates a passphrase which we then receive from Fireblocks for secure storage. This is required in the extreme event that your entire team loses access to their devices, e.g. no one can remember their recovery passphrase. It is particularly important for small teams.
solution-article.description: The Fireblocks soft recovery enrollment, is an additional process undertaken by the customer to ensure they never lose access to their cryptocurrency. The process creates a passphrase which we then receive from Fireblocks for secure storage. This is required in the extreme event that your entire team loses access to their devices, e.g. no one can remember their recovery passphrase. It is particularly important for small teams.
solution-article.title: What is the Fireblocks soft recovery enrollment?

solution-article.desc-un-html: If you need to change the Workspace Owner, you will need to make the request directly to your Fireblocks account manager and advise Coincover you are making this change. In the event that the recovery passphrase has been lost, compromised or there is a risk of compromise (the ex-owner of the workspace knows the passphrase but has left the company), you must make the request to recreate the backup kit.
solution-article.description:
If you need to change the Workspace Owner, you will need to make the request directly to your Fireblocks account manager and advise Coincover you are making this change.

 

In the event that the recovery passphrase has been lost, compromised or there is a risk of compromise (the ex-owner of the workspace knows the passphrase but has left the company), you must make the request to recreate the backup kit.
solution-article.title: What if I need to make changes to a workspace

solution-article.desc-un-html: The MPC device key share is the third of a set of 3 key shares, that is stored physically on the device. A copy of this key share is stored on Fireblocks managed cloud services, encrypted with the owner’s recovery passphrase. Under the soft recovery setup with Coincover - an additional copy of this key share is created, encrypted with the auto-generated passphrase that is stored by Coincover.
solution-article.description: The MPC device key share is the third of a set of 3 key shares, that is stored physically on the device. A copy of this key share is stored on Fireblocks managed cloud services, encrypted with the owner’s recovery passphrase. Under the soft recovery setup with Coincover - an additional copy of this key share is created, encrypted with the auto-generated passphrase that is stored by Coincover.
solution-article.title: What Does The MPC Key Share Mean?

solution-article.desc-un-html: Our Recovery process is simple but secure and can typically recover access to your account in as little as 2 working days. Recovering Device Access If the Account Owner loses access to their device, Coincover work with Fireblocks to get you back up and running on a new device. You will need to follow the steps below: The Account Owner is required to contact Fireblocks in order to initiate their recovery. Fireblocks will inform Coincover of the request - Coincover contact the user directly to validate this request. Fireblocks will set the Account Owner's device into 'recovery mode'. Coincover will decrypt the Account Owner's recovery passphrase and share it securely. The Account Owner then enters the recovery passphrase into the Fireblocks app to complete the recovery. Recovering Account Access In the unlikely event that Fireblocks is no longer operational, the customer will still be able to gain access to their wallet's private keys protected by Coincover following the steps below: The Account Owner uses a Fireblocks tool to initiate the recovery and then contacts Coincover. Coincover will verify the recovery. We will require at least 2 members from your company who are on the ACL to authorise the request. Once verified, Coincover will retrieve your backup data and then use the Backup Key to decrypt the Fireblocks key shares, before sharing this with the Account Owner. The backup material can be used with the Fireblocks tool to decrypt and regain access to the private keys.
solution-article.description:
Our Recovery process is simple but secure and can typically recover access to your account in as little as 2 working days.

 

Recovering Device Access

 

If the Account Owner loses access to their device, Coincover work with Fireblocks to get you back up and running on a new device.  You will need to follow the steps below:

  • The Account Owner is required to contact Fireblocks in order to initiate their recovery.
  • Fireblocks will inform Coincover of the request - Coincover contact the user directly to validate this request.
  • Fireblocks will set the Account Owner's device into 'recovery mode'.
  • Coincover will decrypt the Account Owner's recovery passphrase and share it securely.
  • The Account Owner then enters the recovery passphrase into the Fireblocks app to complete the recovery.

 

Recovering Account Access

 

In the unlikely event that Fireblocks is no longer operational, the customer will still be able to gain access to their wallet's private keys protected by Coincover following the steps below:

  • The Account Owner uses a Fireblocks tool to initiate the recovery and then contacts Coincover.
  • Coincover will verify the recovery.  We will require at least 2 members from your company who are on the ACL to authorise the request.
  • Once verified, Coincover will retrieve your backup data and then use the Backup Key to decrypt the Fireblocks key shares, before sharing this with the Account Owner.
  • The backup material can be used with the Fireblocks tool to decrypt and regain access to the private keys.
solution-article.title: What is the process for a recovery?

solution-article.desc-un-html: Contractually we can only recover assets to members who are currently on the ACL. Companies can add or remove ACLs at any time to meet the needs of their business organisation so we recommend that this checked regularly by yourselves to ensure the ACL still contains valid members. In the extreme event that all ACL members become unavailable due to an accident, the process of recovery would then require a large amount of extra validation that would be guided on an individual basis by our legal department.
solution-article.description:
Contractually we can only recover assets to members who are currently on the ACL. 

 

Companies can add or remove ACLs at any time to meet the needs of their business organisation so we recommend that this checked regularly by yourselves to ensure the ACL still contains valid members. 

In the extreme event that all ACL members become unavailable due to an accident, the process of recovery would then require a large amount of extra validation that would be guided on an individual basis by our legal department.
solution-article.title: What happens if we want to make a recovery but the original ACLs on file are no longer available or involved in the company?

solution-article.desc-un-html: The reason a test environment needs to be created is down to security - recovering full key share material means decrypting the key shares and also undergoing a full reconstruction of the key shares into one extended private key. Doing this means introducing a single point of failure and should only be done in a real-life scenario. The Test Recovery is for process orientation only and to get the customer comfortable how the recovery process works.
solution-article.description:
The reason a test environment needs to be created is down to security - recovering full key share material means decrypting the key shares and also undergoing a full reconstruction of the key shares into one extended private key.  Doing this means 

introducing a single point of failure and should only be done in a real-life scenario. The Test Recovery is for process orientation only and to get the customer comfortable how the recovery process works.
solution-article.title: Why do we need to create a test environment to do a test recovery?

solution-article.desc-un-html: The Workspace Owner's device for the live environment cannot be used for the test environment. Any other phone including those belonging to the other members of the ACL list may be used. Fireblocks will need to be supplied with with the full name and email address of the intended device user - the phone number is not required. Only one user is needed on this workspace regardless if they are or are not in the live environment.
solution-article.description: The Workspace Owner's device for the live environment cannot be used for the test environment.  Any other phone including those belonging to the other members of the ACL list may be used.   Fireblocks will need to be supplied with with the full name and email address of the intended device user - the phone number is not required. Only one user is needed on this workspace regardless if they are or are not in the live environment.
solution-article.title: What phone and email do we need to use for the test recovery - do they need to be set up on the live environment as well?

solution-article.desc-un-html: The Fireblocks soft recovery enrolment, is an additional process undertaken by the customer to ensure they never lose access to their cryptocurrency. The process creates a passphrase which we then receive from Fireblocks for secure storage. This is required in the extreme event that your entire team loses access to their devices, e.g. no one can remember their recovery passphrase. It is particularly important for small teams.
solution-article.description: The Fireblocks soft recovery enrolment, is an additional process undertaken by the customer to ensure they never lose access to their cryptocurrency. The process creates a passphrase which we then receive from Fireblocks for secure storage. This is required in the extreme event that your entire team loses access to their devices, e.g. no one can remember their recovery passphrase. It is particularly important for small teams.
solution-article.title: What Is The Soft Recovery Enrolment?

solution-article.desc-un-html: The simplest way is by adding a 'Viewer Only API Token' to your BitGo account. By using this method, Coincover will not have the ability to transfer any funds, however we will have visibility of the user account. Full instructions can be sent on how to set up either option by contacting support@coincover.com
solution-article.description:
The simplest way is by adding a 'Viewer Only API Token' to your BitGo account. By using this method, Coincover will not have the ability to transfer any funds, however we will have visibility of the user account. 


Full instructions can be sent on how to set up either option by contacting support@coincover.com
solution-article.title: How do I generate a reporting BitGo token?

solution-article.desc-un-html: The BitGo reporting token allows Coincover read-view access to the customer BitGo wallets that are protected by Coincover. This is so that we can monitor the wallets and measure the transactions and exposure levels. The service works by sending an alert to our system every time a transaction happens. Coincover then uses the the access token to query the transaction, check it against our system and flag it if suspicious. In the event of a suspicious transaction or a transaction outside of the agreed limits, Coincover may contact the customer to investigate and take any required action such as freezing the wallet.
solution-article.description: The BitGo reporting token allows Coincover read-view access to the customer BitGo wallets that are protected by Coincover. This is so that we can monitor the wallets and measure the transactions and exposure levels. The service works by sending an alert to our system every time a transaction happens. Coincover then uses the the access token to query the transaction, check it against our system and flag it if suspicious. In the event of a suspicious transaction or a transaction outside of the agreed limits, Coincover may contact the customer to investigate and take any required action such as freezing the wallet.
solution-article.title: Why do I need to generate a reporting BitGo token?

solution-article.desc-un-html: At Coincover we aim to provide the highest level of service to our customers. However, if you aren't completely happy with our service, please email complaints@coincover.com and we will attempt to resolve the issue within 48 hours during the hours of business (9am - 5pm Monday to Friday). In the unlikely event that we are unable to resolve the issue to your satisfaction, we will investigate further and respond within 8 weeks.
solution-article.description: At Coincover we aim to provide the highest level of service to our customers. However, if you aren't completely happy with our service, please email complaints@coincover.com and we will attempt to resolve the issue within 48 hours during the hours of business (9am - 5pm Monday to Friday). In the unlikely event that we are unable to resolve the issue to your satisfaction, we will investigate further and respond within 8 weeks.
solution-article.title: How do I make a complaint?

solution-article.desc-un-html: Please contact us by emailing support@coincover.com - we will respond within 48 hours during the hours of business (9am - 5pm Monday to Friday).
solution-article.description: Please contact us by emailing support@coincover.com - we will respond within 48 hours during the hours of business (9am - 5pm Monday to Friday).
solution-article.title: How do I contact Coincover Support Team?

solution-article.desc-un-html: Please contact us by emailing support@coincover.com - we will respond within 48 hours during the hours of business (9am - 5pm Monday to Friday).
solution-article.description: Please contact us by emailing support@coincover.com - we will respond within 48 hours during the hours of business (9am - 5pm Monday to Friday).

solution-article.desc-un-html: Payment can be made in BTC or Fiat. You can also pay via PayPal. We currently do not accept Stable Coin
solution-article.description: Payment can be made in BTC or Fiat. You can also pay via PayPal. We currently do not accept Stable Coin
solution-article.title: How do I pay my invoice?

solution-article.desc-un-html: If you need to make a change to any members of your ACL, please contact us at support@coincover.com we will respond within 48 hours during the hours of business (9am - 5pm Monday to Friday) to arrange a video conference call at your convenience. Three members of the existing ACL will need to be present on the call. The call should only take around 10 minutes to complete.
solution-article.description: If you need to make a change to any members of your ACL, please contact us at support@coincover.com we will respond within 48 hours during the hours of business (9am - 5pm Monday to Friday) to arrange a video conference call at your convenience. Three members of the existing ACL will need to be present on the call. The call should only take around 10 minutes to complete.
solution-article.title: How do I add/remove an Access Control List(ACL) member?

solution-article.desc-un-html: Protection is activated once the following onboarding steps are complete: Service documentation signing ID checks for all Access Control List (ACL) members Payment of invoice Once all these steps are complete we aim to get you protected within 5 days.
solution-article.description:
Protection is activated once the following onboarding steps are complete:

  • Service documentation signing
  • ID checks for all Access Control List (ACL) members
  • Payment of invoice

Once all these steps are complete we aim to get you protected within 5 days.
solution-article.title: When is my protection activated?

solution-article.desc-un-html: This is dependent on your Supply of Services contract. If you are unsure, please contact support@coincover and we will check the details for you.
solution-article.description: This is dependent on your Supply of Services contract.  If you are unsure, please contact support@coincover and we will check the details for you.
solution-article.title: What is the renewal process?

solution-article.desc-un-html: If you require protection for additional workspaces, please contact us at support @coincover. We will liaise with our success and legal teams who will reach out to you and get you set up for onboarding as quickly as possible.
solution-article.description: If you require protection for additional workspaces, please contact us at support @coincover. We will liaise with our success and legal teams who will reach out to you and get you set up for onboarding as quickly as possible.

solution-article.desc-un-html: Currently, Coincover does not protect NFTs.
solution-article.description: Currently, Coincover does not protect NFTs.

solution-article.desc-un-html: We protect the following wallets and exchanges: Atomic Wallet, Binance, Bitfinex, Bittrex, Celsius, Coinbase, Crypto.com, Exodus, FTX, Gemini, Kraken, MetaMask, NDAX, Newton, Poloniex, Shakepay, Trust Wallet, Wealthsimple

solution-article.desc-un-html: The cost of Personal Crypto Protection depends on the plan you select. View the Personal Crypto Protection Plan here. (https://www.coincover.com/products/personal-crypto-protection#pricing-table)
solution-article.description: The cost of Personal Crypto Protection depends on the plan you select. View the Personal Crypto Protection Plan here. (https://www.coincover.com/products/personal-crypto-protection#pricing-table)
solution-article.title: How much does it cost to protect my wallet with Coincover?

solution-article.desc-un-html: Coincover are the only providers of Personal Crypto Protection. Personal Crypto Protection uses the only technology in the world that protects over 200 types of crypto assets and is underpinned by an insurance-backed Anti-Theft Guarantee to help safeguard crypto investors against financial loss due to hacks or theft. You can only buy Personal Crypto Protection at Coincover. https://www.coincover.com/products/personal-crypto-protection
solution-article.description: Coincover are the only providers of Personal Crypto Protection. Personal Crypto Protection uses the only technology in the world that protects over 200 types of crypto assets and is underpinned by an insurance-backed Anti-Theft Guarantee to help safeguard crypto investors against financial loss due to hacks or theft. You can only buy Personal Crypto Protection at Coincover. https://www.coincover.com/products/personal-crypto-protection
solution-article.title: Where can I buy Personal Crypto Protection?

solution-article.desc-un-html: Our hack checking technology looks for suspicious activity from your wallet, including unauthorized transactions. We’re analyzing how hackers behave to better protect Coincover users.
solution-article.description: Our hack checking technology looks for suspicious activity from your wallet, including unauthorized transactions. We’re analyzing how hackers behave to better protect Coincover users.
solution-article.title: What does Hack Checker do?

solution-article.desc-un-html: No, what we do is better. Our technology reduces the risk that your funds will be stolen in the first place by identifying suspicious activity. Less risk means lower costs, so Personal Crypto Protection is more cost-effective than paying directly for personal insurance. You get the benefit of our Anti-Theft Guarantee, which is backed by the insurance policy we have with certain underwriters at Lloyd's of London. This means in the unlikely event that our technology does not prevent a theft, you can claim funds stolen up to the level of Anti-Theft Guarantee you purchased, but technically you do not have insurance.
solution-article.description:
No, what we do is better.


Our technology reduces the risk that your funds will be stolen in the first place by identifying suspicious activity. Less risk means lower costs, so Personal Crypto Protection is more cost-effective than paying directly for personal insurance. You get the benefit of our Anti-Theft Guarantee, which is backed by the insurance policy we have with certain underwriters at Lloyd's of London.


This means in the unlikely event that our technology does not prevent a theft, you can claim funds stolen up to the level of Anti-Theft Guarantee you purchased, but technically you do not have insurance.
solution-article.title: Will I be insured with Personal Crypto Protection?

solution-article.desc-un-html: Please visit our Privacy Policy page for full details of how Coincover manages data
solution-article.description: Please visit our Privacy Policy page for full details of how Coincover manages data
solution-article.title: What do you do with my data?

solution-article.desc-un-html: In the unlikely event that Coincover is no longer operational, we have set up an independent entity - Digital Asset Recovery Limited (DAR) to act as a services provider. This is a separate entity that we have set up and funded to act on our behalf to recover assets in this instance.
solution-article.description: In the unlikely event that Coincover is no longer operational, we have set up an independent entity - Digital Asset Recovery Limited (DAR) to act as a services provider. This is a separate entity that we have set up and funded to act on our behalf to recover assets in this instance.
solution-article.title: What happens if you are no longer operational?

solution-article.desc-un-html: Coincover Personal Crypto Protection is a technology solution that is underpinned by an insurance-backed Anti-Theft Guarantee that helps safeguard against financial loss due to hacks or thefts. When you purchase our product you are required to link your wallet, this enables our hack checking technology to identify suspicious activity from your wallet. In the event that our technology doesn't prevent a theft from unauthorised access you can claim funds stolen up to the level of protection purchased.
solution-article.description: Coincover Personal Crypto Protection is a technology solution that is underpinned by an insurance-backed Anti-Theft Guarantee that helps safeguard against financial loss due to hacks or thefts. When you purchase our product you are required to link your wallet, this enables our hack checking technology to identify suspicious activity from your wallet. In the event that our technology doesn't prevent a theft from unauthorised access you can claim funds stolen up to the level of protection purchased.
solution-article.title: Why do I need to connect my wallet?

solution-article.desc-un-html: When you purchase Personal Crypto Protection plan, you can claim hacked or lost funds up to the limit specified in the plan.
solution-article.description: When you purchase Personal Crypto Protection plan, you can claim hacked or lost funds up to the limit specified in the plan.
solution-article.title: Is 100% of my crypto protected?

solution-article.desc-un-html: To protect over $100,000 you will need to select our Max plan which includes Anti-Theft Guarantee for over $100,000. You will need to fill out the form for the Max plan, which you can find here - **LINK TO VIP FORM**
solution-article.description: To protect over $100,000 you will need to select our Max plan which includes Anti-Theft Guarantee for over $100,000. You will need to fill out the form for the Max plan, which you can find here - **LINK TO VIP FORM**
solution-article.title: Can I get protection for over $100,000?

solution-article.desc-un-html: The price does not change in relation to the value of your cryptocurrency. You can reclaim hacked or lost funds up to a certain amount depending on your plan.
solution-article.description:
The price does not change in relation to the value of your cryptocurrency. 


You can reclaim hacked or lost funds up to a certain amount depending on your plan.

solution-article.desc-un-html: If you feel dissatisfied with any aspect of the service you have received from us, we welcome your feedback. If you wish to make a complaint, please email complaints@coincover.com If you prefer to put your complaint in writing, you can send it to: Complaints Officer Coincover Capital Building Tyndall Street, Cardiff CF10 4AZ

solution-article.desc-un-html: You can make any amendments or cancel your plan using the Coincover portal. Alternatively you can contact us if you need assistance.
solution-article.description: You can make any amendments or cancel your plan using the Coincover portal. Alternatively you can contact us if you need assistance.
solution-article.title: How do I cancel my Personal Crypto Protection plan?

solution-article.desc-un-html: You can pay for your plan either annually or monthly (*excludes the Lite plan) using a valid card payment method.
solution-article.description: You can pay for your plan either annually or monthly (*excludes the Lite plan) using a valid card payment method.
solution-article.title: How do I pay for my Personal Crypto Protection plan?

solution-article.desc-un-html: The Lite plan is payable annually. All other plans give you the option to pay monthly or annually.
solution-article.description: The Lite plan is payable annually. All other plans give you the option to pay monthly or annually.
solution-article.title: Can I pay monthly for my personal crypto protection plan?

solution-article.desc-un-html: The plan subscription will renew automatically using your saved payment method, so long as the payment details are up to date. You will then receive email confirmation of your renewal.
solution-article.description:
The plan subscription will renew automatically using your saved payment method, so long as the payment details are up to date.


You will then receive email confirmation of your renewal.
solution-article.title: What is the renewal process?
